title: Apollo 204 (later renamed Apollo 1)crewmembers Grissom, White & Chaffee lost their lives in a fire at Pad 34

images.description: Apollo 1 backup crew egress training at the Manned Spacecraft Center. In open hatch holding on to life raft is Astronaut Donn F. Eisele.
Astronaut Walter M. Schirra, Jr., backup command pilot for the first manned Apollo mission, is hoisted aboard a US Coast Guard helicopter during water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico.

The Apollo 1 backup crew relaxes aboard the NASA Motor Vessel Retriever prior to suiting up for water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico. (l-r) Astronauts Donn F. Eisele, Walter Cunningham, and Walter M. Schirra, Jr.
Astronaut Donn F. Eisele, prime crew member of the first Apollo space flight, aboard the NASA Motor Vessel Retriever suited up in preparation for Apollo water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico.

Apollo 1 backup crew water egress training. Egressing through open hatch of Apollo boilerplate is Astronaut Walter M. Schirra, Jr. Seated in life raft are Astronauts Donn F. Eisele (l) and Walter Cunningham.
Apollo 1 backup crew water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico. Floating in life raft are (l-r) Astronauts Donn F. Eisele, Walter Cunningham, and Walter M. Schirra, Jr.
The Apollo 204 backup crew during suitup prior to altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during suitup prior to altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during suitup prior to altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during altitude chamber tests at KSC
Apollo Spacecraft 012 CSM being moved to Operations Building
Spacecraft 012 command and service modules are moved from a test stand to be mated with Saturn Lunar Module Adapter no.5

Apollo spacecraft 012 left the Manned Spacecraft Operations Building at the Kennedy Space Center and was trucked to launch complex 34 for mating with Saturn-1B launch vehicle in preparation for the first manned Apollo mission
The Apollo 204 spacecraft is prepared for mating to Saturn I-B AS-204

Apollo spacecraft 012 is hoisted to the top of the gantry at launch complex 34 at the Kennedy Space Center for mating with the Saturn-1B launch vehicle in preparation for the first manned Apollo mission.
The crew of Apollo 204 died during a fire which broke out in the command module during training
Apollo 204 astronauts (left to right) Virgil I. Grissom, Edward H. White II and Roger B. Chaffee pose in front of the gantry at launch complex 34 at the Kennedy Space Cent
Apollo 204 command pilot Virgil I. Grissom is suiting up at the Kennedy Space Center in preparation for training aboard the spacecraft at launch complex 34.
Apollo 204 senior pilot Edward H. White II is suiting up at the Kennedy Space Center in preparation for training aboard the spacecraft at launch complex 34.
